decks.notes: The deck is focused on aggressive gameplay with Kefka, Court Mage as the commander. It includes a mix of removal spells like Terminate, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt, as well as counterspells like Force Spike and Mana Leak to control the board. The deck also includes creatures like Barrowgoyf and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, there are powerful card draw spells such as Brainstorm and Preordain to keep the hand full and maintain tempo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and untap effects to disrupt your opponent's game plan. With Lier, Disciple of the Drowned as the commander, you can efficiently use your graveyard as a resource to recur key spells and maintain card advantage. By utilizing cards like Cryptic Command, Counterspell, and Brainstorm, you can consistently outmaneuver your opponent and protect your own key threats. The deck is built around generating massive amounts of mana with High Tide and Extraplanar Lens, allowing you to cast powerful spells like Brain Freeze and Archmage's Charm to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on control through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, with Elminster as the commander. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. Cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Snapcaster Mage provide card advantage and utility. Various board wipes like Wrath of God and Supreme Verdict help maintain control of the board. The deck also includes a win condition with Approach of the Second Sun. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game, answering threats, and out-valuing the opponent until Elminster can secure a victory.

This aggro deck revolves around utilizing Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander to quickly overwhelm opponents with creatures and disruptive spells. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Thraben Inspector and Recruiter of the Guard, along with powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition. Key support cards like Skullclamp and Stoneforge Mystic help generate card advantage and provide additional threats on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Drannith Magistrate and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents' game plans. With a strong mana base and a focus on aggressive plays, this deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain board control throughout the game.

This deck revolves around utilizing Elminster as the commander to control the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options. The main focus is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain a strong board presence by utilizing cards like Spell Snare, Counterspell, Disallow, and Cryptic Command. The deck also includes various utility lands like Castle Vantress, Ghost Quarter, and Mystic Sanctuary to further control the game. Additionally, powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide card advantage and powerful abilities to help maintain control of the game. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through a strong control game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrifice synergies. By utilizing Juri, Master of the Revue as the commander, the deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value, generating tokens, dealing damage, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a mix of low mana cost creatures, removal spells, sacrifice outlets, and key combo pieces to create a fast-paced and powerful aggro strategy that can quickly take control of the game. The goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game before they have a chance to recover.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively using Kefka, Court Mage as the commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck includes a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that support an aggressive playstyle. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Terminate provide removal options for dealing with opposing threats, while creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Baleful Strix offer additional utility and value. The deck also includes countermagic like Counterspell and Force of Will to protect key plays and disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the goal is to control the board and pressure the opponent with efficient threats to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful lands-matter abilities of The Gitrog Monster in conjunction with combo pieces to generate incremental advantage and eventually assemble a game-winning combo. The deck includes a mix of lands that sacrifice themselves for value, such as Barren Moor and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, alongside key combo pieces like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. By using cards like Life from the Loam to recur lands from the graveyard and ramp spells like Exploration, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong mana base while disrupting opponents with cards like Raven's Crime and Thoughtseize. Finally, the deck looks to close out the game with powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End and Primeval Titan.
